* changes to sdf specification from sdf8 (mostly sensors)

pull_request.title: Backport from sdf8 -> sdf7: cmake and sdf spec changes

pullrequest.title: Backport from sdf8 -> sdf7: cmake and sdf spec changes

content.raw:
normally, I would say that the change made in pull request #532 shouldn't have been made like; it should have been changed in the next version of the sdformat spec

however, the way it was implemented was a bit strange, in that it uses [mixed content](https://www.w3schools.com/xml/schema_complex_mixed.asp):

example from [test/sdf/sensors.sdf](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/sdf8/test/sdf/sensors.sdf)

~~~
<!-- sdf8: custom_rpy and grav_dir_x have attribute and value -->
<orientation_reference_frame>
  <localization>ENU</localization>
  <custom_rpy parent_frame="linka">0 1 0</custom_rpy>
  <grav_dir_x parent_frame="linkb">0 0 1</grav_dir_x>
</orientation_reference_frame>
~~~

~~~
<!-- sdf6: custom_rpy and grav_dir_x have mixed content value -->
<orientation_reference_frame>
  <localization>ENU</localization>
  <custom_rpy><parent_frame>linka</parent_frame>0 1 0</custom_rpy>
  <grav_dir_x><parent_frame>linkb<parent_frame>0 0 1</grav_dir_x>
</orientation_reference_frame>
~~~

mixed content can be valid xml, but it requires an extra attribute to be set in the schema, and it's a bit weird since we don't use it anywhere else. since this code hasn't been used in gazebo, I would propose backporting the attribute change both here and to `sdf6` if we want things to be consistent
content.html:
normally, I would say that the change made in pull request #532 shouldn't have been made like; it should have been changed in the next version of the sdformat spec

however, the way it was implemented was a bit strange, in that it uses mixed content:

example from test/sdf/sensors.sdf

<!-- sdf8: custom_rpy and grav_dir_x have attribute and value -->
<orientation_reference_frame>
  <localization>ENU</localization>
  <custom_rpy parent_frame="linka">0 1 0</custom_rpy>
  <grav_dir_x parent_frame="linkb">0 0 1</grav_dir_x>
</orientation_reference_frame>

<!-- sdf6: custom_rpy and grav_dir_x have mixed content value -->
<orientation_reference_frame>
  <localization>ENU</localization>
  <custom_rpy><parent_frame>linka</parent_frame>0 1 0</custom_rpy>
  <grav_dir_x><parent_frame>linkb<parent_frame>0 0 1</grav_dir_x>
</orientation_reference_frame>

mixed content can be valid xml, but it requires an extra attribute to be set in the schema, and it's a bit weird since we don't use it anywhere else. since this code hasn't been used in gazebo, I would propose backporting the attribute change both here and to sdf6 if we want things to be consistent

content.raw: I'm ok not ticktocking. But maybe one way of doing it would be to accept both the element and the attribute in `sdf7`.
content.html: I'm ok not ticktocking. But maybe one way of doing it would be to accept both the element and the attribute in sdf7.

content.raw: `parent_frame` was introduced in pull request #284. However, I think the corresponding gazebo changes that make use of this param were never merged. It’s likely another orphaned param in sdformat…
content.html: parent_frame was introduced in pull request #284. However, I think the corresponding gazebo changes that make use of this param were never merged. It’s likely another orphaned param in sdformat…

pullrequest.title: Backport from sdf8 -> sdf7: cmake and sdf spec changes

content.raw:
this change was made in pull request #532

looking at the [example test/sdf/sensor.sdf](#!/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/532/blueprint-imu-sensor/diff#Ltest/sdf/sensors.sdfT208), I think this is a necessary change, since it's a bit unusual for a tag to have child elements and a value

I'm not sure how to tick-tock. We could backport this to sdf6 as well?
content.html:
this change was made in pull request #532

looking at the example test/sdf/sensor.sdf, I think this is a necessary change, since it's a bit unusual for a tag to have child elements and a value

I'm not sure how to tick-tock. We could backport this to sdf6 as well?
